A game that can be fun to play (either alone or with friends) but i simply cant give this a positive review due to the fact at how many bugs there are

But DbD takes it to a whole new level (e.g. me getting kicked out of the match, losing all progress or getting the infinite loading screen which makes me force quit the game and still loose unsaved progress)

Dev's are complete Tools who will pretend everything is just fine and under control when it's evidently not.

That's right, it's one of those Titles. So if you are looking for a good community that aims to thrive and prosper you're definitely in the wrong neck of the woods.

There are plenty of bugs, the main one being the Dev believing that they can handle a computer beyond plugging it in.

Playtesting is evidently not a thing despite bhvr studios claiming otherwise, which if true can lead you to the conclusion that these guys are complete freshmen when it comes to anything related to this game or gaming in general.

Don't get me wrong, from time to time when they feel like doing something out of sheer boredom they might try to balance the game, but only after the community has been crying about it for a few months.

And do not get me started on the DBD Forums where the community as well as the community councilors really start to shine in all its glory. It is what you would imagine when met with the idea of a ROBLOX Forum, only alot worse. I would rather subject myself to having feces flung at me by orangutans at the Zoo than having to wade through the endless drivel and entitlement that is going on over there.

The game has a "Ranking System".
Let me try that again.

The game has a habit of assigning a random number to your Account which is called your "Rank" going from 20(lowest) up to 1(highest).
The higher you get the more salty the stew will become, the more often you will be told to go kill yourself because some scrub across the country decided it would be a great idea to spend most of his time in life playing a game that he sucks at, knows that he sucks at and consequently became so frustrated that he even started to believe that spewing out shitpost after shitpost on an online computergame would be a good idea to solve his problems.

Not to mention that you will have ranks across the board in your lobbies regularly even so after they have "fixed the matchmaking". Pretty good job so far, right?

You are new to the game and want to play killer? Get ready to be bullied by survivors that are 10 ranks+ above you.
You are new to the game and want to play survivor? Same thing vice versa.

Now the game concept is far from complex and the basics can be learned rather quickly.
Beyond that it is all up to how much time you invest into the game to learn how to master it.

Having said all that, I am having alot of fun with the game and I don't even know why. It is strangely addicting despite its many flaws.
It is very grindy and you will spend hundreds of hours if you want to unlock every perk.
Even more so if you want to prestige all characters, which will likely take you anywhere between 500-1500 hours.

Can I recommend the game?
No.

The same way I cannot recommend anybody to start smoking cigarettes.
Most of the time it will taste like shit, you'll get addicted and it will hurt you in the long run.
And still there is something strangely rewarding about the game.

If you really looking to get it, wait for a sale that happens rather frequently. Hold off on the DLC until you have played for atleast 50 hours, have tried out both survivor and killer side of the game and played enough matches to realize how things are running in this game. You're definitely in for a loopy hellride.

1/26/20 In updating this review, I remain with it. Devs continue to make decisions that make no sense while failing completely to communicate with the playerbase.

8/11/20 Another update half a year later. Hopped back in to check up on the state of the game.
It's even glitchier than it has been before. Even saw the exact same bug within 2 minutes of starting
the first round. Well Played BHVR. You can't tell me this was an oversight, you can't be this blind, it's impossible.

Excellent concept with generally good execution. You have to take the odd bug or unbalanced mechanic with a grain of salt as the devs tend to get round to them, just slowly. All in all a brilliant game.

It's a paid game that's pretty much pay to win at that point, since some characters are paid only, and the oithers that you can get for free requires AGES of grinding. Gettting a perk from a character you don't have is also tied to grinding but is also RANDOM.

And now they're adding a season pass (the kind of stuff we've already seen in no other but the best game ever, Fortnite ... heugh ...) Because the game didn't have enough garbage already.

Not to mention this game STILL has some issues since launch including (but not limited to) : Awful optimisation, skill check animation is stuttering, getting stuck on some geometry for nonsensical reason and some awful lag and desync even after the dedicated servers update.
Одни лаги, не рекомендую!

This game is good but the company behind i dont trust. to unfair hitboxes, vpn users not being atleast suspended for connecting to servers cross globe (i faced a killer for south america as im from europe) and their hit detection being awful and lets also not forget they do bugfixes to things that shouldnt be bugfixed at all, and lets not forget my friend with almost 3k hours in the game got banned for teaming with a survivor for just giving the survivor hatch. and with the deathslinger chapter release they now force people to use anti aliasing in the graphics option when it makes the game blurry as heck and makes me dizzy just looking at the game. i dont reccomend this game at the moment i regret reccomending it in the past cause the past few weeks has been some of BHVR's most laughable at the moment

Alright, so. I usually hate everything that has to do with horror, jumpscares and psychological warfare. But this. This game. 
I mean, let's not lie, i still hate it. But i love the way it absorbs me and my friends. How we're dragged into it and plays it for hours. How we try to play tactical and survive. Which doesn't always go that well. But sometimes lady luck smiles towards you. 
If you are easily scared, and like me, doesn't like horror games. This is a fun, game to play! Because you work together towards a goal, and not just to be scared. 
Or if you just like to scare people, you can in this.. .
